channel.title: Tutorials on jurjen.dev
channel.description: Recent content in Tutorials on jurjen.dev

item.title: Modern Javascript
item.description: It’s not 1995 anymore… A list of links to modern Javascript features. Basically my todo list of things to get familiar with. Expect tutorials on this subject in the future :)

item.title: Basic DOM traversal
item.description: Having made such a nice collapsible in the last tutorial, it would be nice if we can apply it to make an entire article foldable. Taking a quick look at the HTML output of our articles it is obvious that it won’t be as easy as making every h1, h2, h3 element collapsible – our markdown converter appears to be making a flat file, even though it’s input is tree structured by the header tags.

item.title: Collapsible
item.description: We will make a component that can show or collapse its content so a page isn’t cluttered too much.

item.title: Finale
item.description: We look back at building our first website and look forward to what else we can learn!

item.title: Bruteforcing sudokus
item.description: Bruteforcing is a simple programming technique for exploring the entire solution space until a correct solution is found.

item.title: Ordering content
item.description: Lets organize the tutorial collection using article tags and tutorial series. Along the way we discover Hugo’s archetypes, front matter, ‘taxonomies’ and will create a simple card view with CSS.

item.title: Getting Started!
item.description: When you write more than a few pages of HTML, you quickly get tired of the nonsense. Which is why Markdown was build. We will look at the Hugo site generator to fold markdown articles into a functional website.

item.title: Navigation
item.description: In this tutorial, we will create a simple navigation bar that works for both mobile and desktop browsers. We will look into Hugos Pipelines and do our first bit of Javascript programming.

item.title: Introduction
item.description: In this series we will explore the basics of HTML, Javascript, CSS and web development by creating a cool tutorial website from the ground up using the Hugo static website generator.
